result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: and Order for Detainer
Warrant Return, In custody of Stearn County, MN - IN DETAINER

Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 1:26 pm.  ADA-requesting warrant.  CT-warrants have been entered in other files.  Warrant is granted.  1:27 pm adj.
AMENDED
Sentencing hearing on May 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Not to possess or consume alcohol. Not to have contact with Mr Taylor Kemis or Jayme Ingles.  DE to be released on April 14th @ 9 a.m.  He is to be released to either Kayla Comeaux or Lori Everetts.  He is to return to the PCJ by 9 a.m. on 4-17-16.

11:56 Defendant David Joseph Comeaux in court with attorney Brian Thomas Smestad.  Defendant David Joseph Comeaux in custody.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JP-clerk  Agreeement reached.  Amended Information filed.  Ct goes over PQWR.  Ct finds DE FVI&K enters plea.  Victims Rights.  DE pleads G to amended count 1, Ct accepts.  Counts 2 & 3 read in and dismissed.  Ct - judgment entered today.  Waiver of PSI.  Ct schedules sentencing.  
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
